info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 6:43PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Washington...northwestern Kane and south central Iron Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 643 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of New Harmony, or 12 miles northwest of Zion National Park, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cedar City, Zion National Park, Cedar Breaks National Monument, Kanarraville, Hamilton Fort and Kolob Canyon. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 35 and 61. Utah Route 56 between mile markers 56 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
